head.title: National Briefing | South: Florida: Campuses Evacuated After Threat

identified-content.org: Virginia Polytechnic Institute and State University

hedline.hl1: National Briefing | South: Florida: Campuses Evacuated After Threat

abstract.p: Six campuses of Broward Community College and two campuses of Florida Atlantic University are evacuated and searched by police after note threatening attack similar to Virginia Tech killings was found (S)

block.p: All six campuses of Broward Community College and two university campuses in South Florida were evacuated and searched by the police after a note threatening an attack was found. The note, mentioning the Virginia Tech killings and threatening a similar attack at the community college, was written on a poster board and found at a Hollywood construction site, said Capt. Tony Rode, a spokesman for the Hollywood police. Florida Atlantic University officials evacuated two campuses that share space with the community college. Earlier this week, the police arrested a man they say admitted writing a note threatening to bomb a Hollywood middle school and another one threatening to set fire to an apartment building. The man, Larry Boynton, 52, is considered a person of interest in the college threat, Captain Rode said.
